sandra.examples.formfill.musicbrain
Class MusicBrain

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
              android.app.Activity
                  sandra.libs.asr.asrlib.ASR
                      sandra.libs.dm.formfilllib.DialogInterpreter
                          sandra.examples.formfill.musicbrain.MusicBrain
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.speech.RecognitionListener, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, XMLAsyncResponse
public class MusicBrain
extends DialogInterpreter
implements XMLAsyncResponse

MusicBrain: App that engages in a form-filling dialog in which the user provides a word, and a start and end date, and the app shows a list of all music albums in the MusicBrainZ database that contain the word in the title and were released between the dates provided It uses the ASRLib and TTSLib libraries for speech recognition and synthesis, and the FormFillLib for dialog management. The structure of the form-filling dialog is indicated in a vxml file (see Chapter 5), which is retrieved from the web using the XMLLib library.

Version:
3.0, 08/18/13
Author:
Zoraida Callejas, Michael McTear

Method Detail

onCreate

protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
Initializes the GUI and starts the spoken dialog

Overrides:
onCreate in class android.app.Activity

setRestartButton

private void setRestartButton()
Initializes the restart button and its listener. When the button is pressed, the activity is started from the scratch. It is useful to carry out another interaction after a previous one has been completed, or to restart the app after a problem with the Internet connection.

startDialog

void startDialog()
Initializes the ASR and TTS engines and retrieves the vxml file from the web. When the file has been successfully retrieved, the processXMLContents method is invoked, which parses and interprets the dialog

retrieveXML

public void retrieveXML(java.lang.String url,
                        java.lang.String url_default)
Retrieves the contents of an XML file in the specified url. If the first url (url) is not accessible, the second url (url_default) is used. When the file has been successfully retrieved, the processXMLContents method is invoked, which parses and interprets the dialog

processXMLContents

public void processXMLContents(java.lang.String xmlContent)
It is invoked when a VXML file has been read from a URL. It parses and interprets the VXML code received in the input string.

Specified by:
processXMLContents in interface XMLAsyncResponse
Parameters:
xmlContent - VXML code containing the structure of the form-filling dialog

parseMusicResults

void parseMusicResults(java.lang.String xmlContent)
Parses the content of the XML response from the MusicBrainZ web service. The result from the parsing is a collection of albums already sorted by dates and without duplicates (see the explanation in MusicBrainParser.java). These albums contain the word uttered by the user in their title. This collection is filtered to keep only the albums released between the dates indicated by the user. The filtered collection is shown in the listView of the GUI

Parameters:
xmlContent - Result from the query to the MusicBrainZ service

filterAlbums

private java.util.TreeSet<Album> filterAlbums(java.util.TreeSet<Album> albumList)
From the list of Albums returned by the MusicBrainZ web service (the ones that have the word specified by the user in their title), it keeps the ones that were released between the dates indicated by the user If the years recognized are not valid (are not in the form YYYY, e.g. 1997), then the albums are not filtered

Parameters:
albumList - List of the albums in MusicBrainZ which title contains the word recognized

showResults

private void showResults(java.util.TreeSet<Album> albums)
Formats the results and shows them in the GUI list view

Parameters:
albums - List of the albums that meet the user query

setTextView

private void setTextView(java.lang.Boolean blank)

processDialogResults

public void processDialogResults(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> result)
Once the VXML file has been interpreted, the results obtained are saved in "albumData", and the web service of MusicBrainZ is queried

Specified by:
processDialogResults in class DialogInterpreter
Parameters:
result - Pairs for each field in the form

setListView

private void setListView(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> albumInfo)
Includes the results in the list view

createAlert

private android.app.AlertDialog createAlert(java.lang.String title,
                                            java.lang.String message)
Creates an alert dialog in which the user must click OK to continue. It is used in the class mainly to provide feedback about errors. The errors during parsing are mainly due to problems with the Internet connection, so if the users click "ok" they are aware of this fact and will try to solve it More about dialogs here: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/dialogs.html

Parameters:
title - Title of the dialog window
message - Message of the dialog
Returns:
alert dialog to be shown
